abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mining Sector
            Institutional Strengthening Technical Assistance Project of
            Papua New Guinea were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            1) Engaging with Women's groups can help achieve
            improved development outcomes in a sector such as mining; 2)
            Technical Assistance and Capacity Building are a multi-year
            activity that may not be completed and all the available
            development outcomes achieved within the life of a single
            project; 3) Technical Assistance projects can have
            significant outputs and outcomes if well designed; 4)
            Technical assistance projects also need to be realistic and
            not too ambitious in scope; 5) The project provides a good
            example of the importance to approach sector reform in an
            integrated, instead of a piecemeal, way; 6) Commitment and
            buy-in from an early stage by sectoral counterparts is
            essential for regulatory/legal/institutional reform and
            subsequent sustainability; 7) Good projects can also be
            highly susceptible to changes in oversight authority; 8)
            Sustainability of Project Components requires a Champion;
            and 9) There needs to be more concerted effort on the part
            of all Government Agencies responsible for project
            implementation to ensure that staffing is adequate to meet
            the objectives of the project.
